articles.author: Eric Reguly
articles.title: Support growing among European governments for COVID-19 vaccine mandates as Omicron cases surge - The Globe and Mail
articles.description: Many EU governments support mandatory vaccination, including Italy, where everyone over 50 is now required to become fully vaccinated
articles.content:
A medical staffer takes a nasal swab for a COVID-19 rapid test in Rome, on Dec. 30, 2021.Andrew Medichini/The Associated Press

articles.title: EU replaces travel ban on South Africa with testing requirements - BusinessTech
articles.description: European Union member states have agreed to lift the air travel ban on southern African countries, which will allow more travel to resume.
articles.content:
European Union member states have agreed to lift the air travel ban on southern African countries, which will allow more travel to resume.
